715.question: To what other competitive baselines is this approach compared?

5-Table1-1.png: The approach is compared to other competitive baselines such as LSTM, HRED, VHRED (attn), MMI, VHRED (attn), Reranking-RL, MinAvgOut, LFT, RL, and MinAvgOut + RL.</s>
This approach is compared to the competitive baselines of LSTM, HRED, and VHRED as reported in Serban et al. (2017a), and VHRED (attn) and Reranking-RL as reported in Niu and Bansal (2018a).</s>

715.answer: LSTMs with and without attention, HRED, VHRED with and without attention, MMI and Reranking-RL

717.question: How much better were results of the proposed models than base LSTM-RNN model?

5-Table1-1.png: The proposed models had F1 scores of 8.05, 5.47, and 5.47 for Activity F1, Entity F1, and Reranking-RL respectively. The base LSTM-RNN model had an F1 score of 1.18 for Activity F1. Therefore, the proposed models were significantly better than the base LSTM-RNN model in all three categories.</s>

The proposed models had F1 scores of 8.05, 5.47, and 5.47 for Activity F1, Entity F1, and Reranking-RL respectively. The base LSTM-RNN model had an F1 score of 1.18 for Activity F1. To determine how much better the proposed models were, we subtract the base LSTM-RNN score from each of the proposed model scores. For Activity F1, the difference is 8.05 - 1.18 = 6.87. For Entity F1, it's 5.47 - 1.81 = 3.66. For Reranking-RL, it's 5.47 - 3.11 = 1.96. So, the proposed models were significantly better than the base LSTM-RNN model in all three categories.</s>

717.answer: on diversity 6.87 and on relevance 4.6 points higher

718.question: Which one of the four proposed models performed best?

5-Table1-1.png: The model 'MinAvgOut + RL' performed the best with an F1 score of 8.05.</s>
The 'MinAvgOut + RL' model performed the best with an F1 score of 8.05.</s>
7-Table4-1.png: The 'Proposed Model' performed the best with an accuracy of 82.9%.</s>
The 'Proposed Model' performed the best with an accuracy of 82.4%.</s>
